Detailed Description

A Window is a control with extended features: It can have a title, softkeys an can be opened modal or modeless.

Member Enumeration Documentation

Reimplemented from Control.

Window::Window (  Control *  parent = 0  ) 
 

Parameters:
parent Pointer to the parent control which embeds the window. Usually a window does only have a parent if it is embedded as child window inside a top level window.

Member Function Documentation

void Window::AddToTitlebar (  DrawableObject &  obj,
BOOLEAN  align_left = TRUE
) 
 

Adds a drawable object to the titlebar of the window. If the window has no title, the drawable object won't be visible. Note that the width of the added drawable object won't be touched after adding it and it is recommended to set the desired width explicitely before.

Parameters:
obj Drawable object which should be added. The object is obtained by the window until Window::RemoveFromTitle is invoked and hence may not be deleted before.
align_left If set to TRUE, the drawable object will be aligned left from the title. If set to FALSE, it will be aligned right from the title.

BOOLEAN Window::Close (  INT  exit_code = 0  )  [virtual]
 

Closes the window. Before closing the method Window::OnClose is invoked, followed by cleaning up the window and child-controls by invoking Control::Cleanup and reassigning the focus if required.

Parameters:
exit_code 
See also:
Window::OnClose

Rect Window::GetClientRect (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the rectangle of the client area of a window in relation to the upper left of the window position. The client area is defined as area below the window title and inside the window border. If the bounding rectangle of the window is required, the method GetBoundingRect (see Component::GetBoundingRect) must be invoked.

See also:
Control::GetClientRect

Reimplemented from Control.

Returns:
Default height of the window (-1, if no default height has been specified).

Reimplemented from Component.

Returns:
Default width of the window (-1, if no default width has been specified).

Reimplemented from Component.

UINT8 Window::GetFocusPriority (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the focus-priority of the window. Per default each window has the focus priority 127. See Window::SetFocusPriority for further details.

const ControlFrameView * Window::GetFrameView (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

The window-frame-view from the current Theme is returned.

const WCHAR * Window::GetTitle (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the title of the window. For backward compatibility with APOXI versions < 1.9.0 a WCHAR-pointer is returned, but internally a WString is used. This means that the returned pointer is only declared as valid until the next SetTitle is invoked.

BOOLEAN Window::HasDefaultSize (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the size of the window is the default-size, which means that it is aligned on the whole desktop respecting the panel. Invoking Window::SetSize, Window::SetWidth or SetHeight results in a non-default-size.

void Window::Init (  Control *  parent = 0  ) 
 

Parameters:
parent Pointer to the parent control which embeds the window. Usually a window does only have a parent if it is embedded as child window inside a top level window.

BOOLEAN Window::IsSyncSoftkeysEnabled (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the synchronization between the softkeys of the window and the panel is enabled. Per default TRUE is returned.

BOOLEAN Window::IsTitleAnimated (   )  const
 

Returns TRUE, if the currently shown title will be animated automatically if the text exceeds the available width.

BOOLEAN Window::IsTransparent (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the window is marked as transparent. See Window::SetTransparent for details.

void Window::OnClose (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if the window will get closed and represents an entry-point for cleaning up things. When the window has the focus child-controls and the window itself will lose the focus after OnClose has been executed.

Reimplemented in AtlItemGridWindow, Alert, AbstractSmsViewerWin, ImageBrowserDetailWin, and SavingProgressWin.

void Window::OnLayoutFrame (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked whenever the size of the window-frame is changed and also when opening a window. Represents an entry-point for layouting drawable-objects, which have been added as part of the frame.

void Window::OnOpen (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, when the Window is opened and can be used for further initialization (Window::IsOpen() returns TRUE when it is invoked inside OnOpen). Control::OnGetFocus() is invoked before OnOpen, Control::OnLayoutClient() is invoked after OnOpen. Use Control::SetBlocked() if user-interaction should be forbidden e. g. when reading out a large provider in OnOpen.

See also:
Control::SetBlocked()

Reimplemented in AtlWindow, AtlItemGridWindow, AtlItemListWindow, AtlItemMenuWindow, AtlLabelListWindow, BtAvrcpControllerDeviceListWindow, BtAvrcpDeviceListWin, BtDeviceListWindow, SmsComposeWin, FmRadioSelectStrongerFreq, ImageBrowserDetailWin, SavingProgressWin, and UibFolderWin.

INT Window::OpenModal (   ) 
 

Wrapper method for Window::OpenModal(Rect()), which means that the window will be opened fullsized.

INT Window::OpenModal (  const Rect &  rect  )  [virtual]
 

Opens the window modal. This means that when invoking this method the caller is blocked until the window gets closed. Note that this does not mean that other applications or the message flow is blocked. Opening a window modeless is e. g. useful for yes/no-dialogs if the result is needed immediately. Opening windows modal lead to a higher call stack, hence it is recommended to avoid opening modal windows in a recursive manner.

Parameters:
rect Specifies the size of the window (by default the window will be opened fullsized).
Returns:
Exit-code (per default 0 is returned).

Reimplemented in Alert.

void Window::OpenModeless (   ) 
 

Wrapper method for Window::OpenModeless(Rect()), which means that the window will be opened fullsized.

void Window::OpenModeless (  const Rect &  rect  )  [virtual]
 

Opens the window modeless. This means that immediatly after the window has been opened the caller of this method may continue and the closing of the window is done in an asynchronous manner.

Parameters:
rect Specifies the size of the window (by default the window will be opened fullsized).

Reimplemented in Alert, and EmsComposeWin.

void Window::RemoveFromTitlebar (  DrawableObject &  obj  ) 
 

Removes the drawable object obj from the titlebar of the window.

void Window::SetDefaultSize (   )  [virtual]
 

Sets the size of the window to the default-size, which means that it is aligned on the whole desktop respecting the panel.

Reimplemented in AtlWindow.

void Window::SetDefaultSizeProperty (  BOOLEAN  has_default_size  )  [inline, protected]
 

Adjusts the default size property of the window without triggering any resize. This might be useful when derived windows implement their customized strategy for defining a default size of the window and require to invoke Window::SetSize. As application developer it usually should not be necessary to invoke this method (Window::SetDefaultSize should be used instead).

void Window::SetFocusPriority (  UINT8  priority  ) 
 

Sets the focus-priority of the window. A window with a lower focus-priority then the currently focused window can not get the focus. Per default each window has the focus priority 127. Note that the focus-priority only matters if a window is open, closed windows never may get a focus. If the focus-priority of a window is changed while the window is open, the window-order is changed to respect the settings. This means that the window may lose the focus if the focus-priority is decreased and may get the focus if the priority is increased.

void Window::SetLeftSoftkey (  Action *  action  ) 
 

Wrapper-method for Window::SetSoftkey(0, action).

BOOLEAN Window::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Used by Aragon to read out the windows property out of the resource parser. It is not allowed for an application developer to invoke this method in a direct manner.

Reimplemented from Control.

Reimplemented in AtlWindow, Alert, ContextMenu, and MessageBox.

void Window::SetRightSoftkey (  Action *  action  ) 
 

Wrapper-method for Window::SetSoftkey(KeyboardConfig::GetSoftkeyCount() - 1, action).

void Window::SetSoftkey (  INT  index,
Action *  action
)  [virtual]
 

Sets the softkey for the window, which will be shown in the panel of the desktop.

Parameters:
index Index of the softkey. The maximum number of softkeys can be retrieved by KeyboardConfig::GetSoftkeyCount.
action Action which should be executed when pressing the softkey.

Reimplemented in AtlWindow.

void Window::SetSyncSoftkeysEnabled (  BOOLEAN  enabled  )  [inline, protected]
 

Allows to enable/disable the synchronization of the softkeys of the window with the panel. Per default the synchronization is enabled.

void Window::SetTitle (  const WString &  title  ) 
 

Wrapper-method for SetTitle(w_str.GetCString()).

void Window::SetTitle (  const WCHAR *  title  )  [virtual]
 

Parameters:
title Title of the window. By default the window has no title. To hide the title while the window is open, SetTitle(0) can be invoked.

Reimplemented in AtlWindow.

void Window::SetTransparent (  BOOLEAN  enabled  ) 
 

Marks the window as transparent if enabled is TRUE. Per default each window is not transparent. To see the transparency the window frame and/or the client area must be drawn by using alpha blending. To keep the resource demand low and the performance high some restrictions are given:

  • The transparency is only respected if the window is in foreground. This means if a window below updates it's content, the transparent foreground window automatically will be redrawn. If the window is marked as transparent and is not in foreground updates of windows behind won't be visible inside the boundaries of the transparent window.
  • The update of windows behind the transparent foreground window are only respected for windows belonging to the same application. Marking the window as transparent mostly is used if a window frame with a fading shadow should be used for popup menus or message boxes.
